Package com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.model

Class Diary

java.lang.Object
com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.model.Diary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Diary extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the user's diary with all the information about him and his eating.
Author:
Davide Mazzatenta

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Returns:
      the diary user

    • getDayList

      public ArrayList<Day> getDayList()
      Returns:
      the diary day list

    • getSumValues

      public Map<AllNutrientNonNutrient,Float> getSumValues()
      Puts in a map the total quantity of nutrients or not nutrients of all days in the diary.
      Returns:
      the total quantity of nutrients or not nutrients of a user's diary

    • getTotalCalories

      public float getTotalCalories()
      Calculates the total calories of all days in the diary. Days have meals, that have foods that have calories.
      Returns:
      all days total calories

    • load

      public static Diary load(String userToken)
      Loads the diary of an user with his token. First checks if the diary you are looking for is in local database and if it's not it checks the remote database on Dropbox. If there isn't a diary associated with the user's token it returns null.
      Parameters:
      userToken - associated with the diary you are looking for
      Returns:
      user's diary you need

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves the diary in local database and in remote database on Dropbox

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the map that contains weight and the respective date by creating a new map in which only the last entry of the old map is inserted. It also clear the day list

    • findDayById

      public Day findDayById(String dayId)
      Finds the day you are looking for through the parameter. Returns it if it was found, otherwise returns null.
      Parameters:
      dayId - is the day date you are searching as a string
      Returns:
      day if it was found in the day list of diary

    • addFood

      public void addFood(String dayId, MealType mealType, Food food)
      Adds food to a specific day and in a specific meal. If the day is not in the day list of the diary it creates one and adds food to meal.
      Parameters:
      dayId - the day you want to add the food to
      mealType - the type of meal you want to add the food to
      food - the food you want to add

    • stringToLocalDate

      public static LocalDate stringToLocalDate(String date)
      Converts string that contains a date given as a parameter to LocalDate.
      Parameters:
      date - as a string that has to be converted into Localdate
      Returns:
      formatted date into LocalDate

    • addWater

      public void addWater(String dayId, Water water)
      Adds water to a specific day in water list. If the day is not in the day list of the diary it creates one and adds water to water list.
      Parameters:
      dayId - the day you want to add the water to
      water - the water you want to add

    • updateWeight

      public void updateWeight(float newWeight, LocalDate date)
      Updates user's weight and corresponding date
      Parameters:
      newWeight - new user's weight that has to replace the old one
      date - date corresponding to the user's new weight

    • doStatistic

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject doStatistic(ArrayList<Filter> filters, StatisticType... statisticType) throws NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      First filters the diary and then calculate statistics regarding specific statistic types given as a parameter. While doing this, exceptions can be thrown if a particular method cannot be found, if a specified class object cannot be instantiated and if an application tries to reflectively create an instance, set or get a field, or invoke a method, but the currently executing method does not have access to the definition of the specified class, field, method or constructor.
      Parameters:
      filters - used to filter diary
      statisticType - statistics you want to do on diary
      Returns:
      statistics on filtered diary in a JSONObject
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - if a method cannot be found
      InvocationTargetException - this holds an exception thrown by an invoked method or constructor
      InstantiationException - when the method newInstance tries to create an instance of a class but the specified class object cannot be instantiated.
      IllegalAccessException - when the method tries to reflectively create an instance, set or get a field, or invoke a method, but the currently executing method does not have access to the definition of the specified class, field, method or constructor.

    • doFilter

      public Diary doFilter(ArrayList<Filter> filters)
      Returns filtered diary by filters given as a parameter and by removing empty days.
      Parameters:
      filters - used to filter diary
      Returns:
      filtered diary

    • toJsonObject

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject toJsonObject()
      Puts the diary into a JSONObject and returns it
      Returns:
      JSONObject which contains diary
